H0.text: The nucleus is the part of a plant cell where photosynthesis occurs.

H1.text: Chloroplast is the part of a plant cell where photosynthesis occurs.

H2.text: Cell membrane is the part of a plant cell where photosynthesis occurs.

H3.text: Cell wall is the part of a plant cell in which photosynthesis occurs.

A4.text: A chloroplast (KLOR-ə-plast, -⁠plahst) is a type of organelle known as a plastid that conducts photosynthesis mostly in plant and algal cells.

A5.text: Chloroplasts have a high concentration of chlorophyll pigments which capture the energy from sunlight and convert it to chemical energy and release oxygen.
